intro: Spiloxene stellata, commonly known as the star-shaped spiloxene, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, star-like white flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Spiloxene stellata is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils.
